abstract: Republican lawmakers in New York Senate are countering Gov Andrew Cuomo's push for state officials to more fully disclose other sources of income, introducing legislation that would expand disclosure to include domestic partners, like Cuomo's celebrity-chef girlfriend Sandra Lee.
lead_paragraph: Legislation in the State Senate aims to expand reporting requirements to include anyone who lives with a public official, whether or not they are married.

headline.main: G.O.P. Plan Would Subject Sandra Lee, Cuomo’s Girlfriend, to Financial Disclosure Rules
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Bill Would Subject Cuomo’s Girlfriend to Financial Disclosure Rules

snippet: Legislation in the State Senate aims to expand reporting requirements to include anyone who lives with a public official, whether or not they are married.
